value.0: So, I see you have set the Halfling free... You know I will not stand for you to let him leave these chambers, don't you?
So, we meet again, young <sir/madam>... You're quite the persistent one, I must say.
<StartAction>[Malthar snarls.]</Start> Come, my men! Let us show this fool what comes of those who cross our path!
Well, now, this is a most interesting turn of events. I suppose I could be swayed to part with a bit of gold for you to no longer interfere with my affairs...
How does a share of 300 gold sound to you?
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> I had hoped we could come to an agreement that would not involve bloodshed, but it seems such is not to be...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sorry, my friend, but 300 it will have to be. Either take it or leave it.

<StartAction>[Success]</Start> You drive a hard bargain, my friend, but I suppose 400 is fair. After all, I will gain a much larger reward when I return this troublesome Halfling to Pharos Nightcrawler.
<StartAction>[Malthar glances over your shoulder. You hear waves lapping at the hull of an incoming ship and a gruff voice calls to Malthar over the water. Malthar smiles.]</Start>
Malthar, it seems Halgok has arrived with the boat. Shall we arrange for the prisoner to be taken aboard?
Just one moment. So tell me, <lad/lass>, do we have a deal?
Good. Perhaps you Imperials are not as noble as everyone claims after all...
<StartAction>[Tarin quickly turns on his heels, preparing to sprint out of the chamber.]</Start> I... I cannot believe you would betray me like this, <FirstName>! I... I must get out of here!
Men! Grab the Halfling! Do not allow him to escape!
<StartAction>[Tarin quickly dodges past the guards, hurrying towards the exit.]</Start> You'll have to do better than that to catch ol' Tarin Lightfingers!
<StartAction>[Lyen twitches in visible anger.]</Start> You will bleed!
<StartAction>[Before Lyen can act, Malthar quickly pulls for a small blowpipe, shooting a poisoned dart into Lyen's neck.]</Start> There, that should quiet the oaf for a while...
<StartAction>[A sudden uproar erupts from the Nightcrawler gang members. Malthar looks about, then begins swearing profusely.]</Start> Curse you, Tarin Lightfingers, how do you always do this!?
<StartAction>[As Malthar hands you the pouch of gold, one of his guards comes running forward quickly.]</Start> Malthar, it seems we have a problem...
And what would that be? Out with it, worm!
<StartAction>[The guard shakes nervously, apparently worried over some new turn of events.]</Start> It seems our quarry, Tarin Lightfingers, has managed to escape his cell...
Curses! Men! Hurry! We must not let the Halfling escape!

<StartAction>[Malthar and his men rush towards the exit, leaving you alone in the chamber, Malthar apparently having forgotten for the moment that he has already given you the gold. Perhaps now would be a good time to leave...]</Start>
I hope this is some sort of ruse, <FirstName>...
You would betray Tarin?! You will live to regret this, <FirstName>...
I'm afraid that's just not possible, <lad/lass>. You see, Tarin Lightfingers will fetch me a far greater amount from Pharos Nightcrawler than any offer you could make.

I would offer you a hefty reward in gold to turn you attention away from this matter, and allow us to depart Ghaarak without trouble. I do suggest you take me up on this offer, as my men and I are quite dangerous when provoked...
I don't believe so, <lad/lass>. The price of Tarin's bounty far exceeds your meager amount.

Now, now, young <lad/lass>, there's no need for threats... Such words spoken here will do little more than get you killed. I assure you we are quite adept at handling far greater challenges than you would pose...
I do have a proposal that I believe might interest you. If you are willing to forget this matter, and disturb my affairs no longer, I would be willing to give you an ample reward in gold.
We will be starting a card game soon, <sir/madam>. Would you care to join us for a few drinks while we wait for everyone to arrive?
As you would have it, <sir/madam>. Should you change your mind, we will be here a bit longer, so feel free to come back if you like.
Excellent! How about a round of drinks for our new friends, eh fella's? <StartAction>[Malthar gives you and Tarin a wide smile, showing a row of bright white teeth.]</Start>
A drink sounds most in order, good chap! My big brutish friend and I will take a nice pint of ale. What about you, <FirstName>? Care for a drink as well?
<StartAction>[Malthar's grin fades just a bit.]</Start> As you wish, <lad/lass>. If you consider yourself too good to drink with the likes of us, it'll just save me a few gold pieces...
<StartAction>[Malthar's grin grows even larger. He passes you and the others three large, foaming mugs of ale. You join Tarin and Lyen in quickly downing the thick drinks.]</Start>
So, when does the card game begin? I'm quite anxious to begin!
I bet you are... <StartAction>[Malthar's expression darkens for a moment, but he quickly hides it.]</Start> But all of our companions have not arrived yet. In the meantime, why don't we chat a bit?

You claimed your name to be Tarin Lightfingers, if I am not mistaken... Would that be the infamous Tarin Lightfingers of Laceri, known throughout the Northern Reaches for his impeccable luck at the card tables?
Well, yes, I suppose that would be me, though I haven't lived in Laceri for quite some time...

<StartAction>[You notice Malthar and his companions have lost their friendly smiles...]</Start> The same Tarin Lightfingers that fled Laceri in cowardice when he lost a sizeable sum of gold to Pharos Nightcrawler?
<StartAction>[Tarin gulps loudly.]</Start> I'm afraid you must be mistaken, my friend... Did... did I say Tarin Lightfingers? I... I meant Aarin Mightflinger! Er... yes... that's it!

<StartAction>[Malthar's eyes narrow dangerously.]</Start> Pharos does not take lightly to Halflings leaving town with unpaid debts... I'm afraid you've gotten quite the bounty on your head, little Halfling...
Lyen... it might be time for you and I to get out of here... <StartAction>[Just as the Halfling begins to rise, his eyes start drooping heavily.]</Start> Er... What... what's happening...
A Halfling with a price on his head shouldn't take drinks from strangers, little fool! Pharos Nightcrawler will be quite happy to have you returned to him for proper ... punishment...
<StartAction>[Lyen tries to stand, but his strength fails him, and he slumps into his chair.]</Start> What treachery... is this?  ...Poison?
<StartAction>[Malthar turns his dark eyes upon you.]</Start> You there, <lad/lass>! We want no trouble from you! Just mind your business, and you won't get hurt!
Good to hear. I'm going to collect a nice bounty on this Halfling's head, and I'll have nothing stand in my way!
Well, that is most unfortunate... Men! Hold off this foolish <boy/girl> while I get the Halfling out of here!
<StartAction>[Suddenly, the other patrons at the table draw their weapons, and lunge towards you as Tarin and Lyen fall from their seats in a deep sleep...]</Start>
<StartAction>[You suddenly feel your own body begin to swoon, and you feel a strong sleepiness creeping into your eyes.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Malthar turns his gaze to Tarin and Lyen, who have quietly fallen from their chairs in a deep sleep.]</Start>
It appears that sleeping herb has worked out nicely after all... Alright, men! Let's get the Halfling out of here, and get him somewhere safe until we can get the ship ready!
Greetings to you, <sir/madam>.
<< SHOULD NOT APPEAR >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_TARI" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
Prepare to die, cur! To arms!
I want a portion of your profit from Tarin's bounty.
No, I won't betray Tarin! Turn him over or die!
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Make it 400, and we have a deal.
That sounds fair.
Yes we do.
I'm here to negotiate the the Halfling's release.
Release him or die!
Well, what else do you propose then?
Forget Pharos. I'll pay 500 gold!
Grant Tarin his freedom or die on the spot!
No thanks.
Sure. <StartAction>[Take a seat at the table.]</Start>
No thanks. Drunkards always lose.
I'd like an ale.
What do I care? The Halfling is yours...
I'll not let you harm Tarin Lightfingers!
